faqs.answers: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, maintained by Facebook.
Vite is a modern frontend build tool that is fast and optimized for web development.

faqs.questions: What is the purpose of CQRS?
faqs.answers: CQRS (Command Query Responsibility Segregation) separates the responsibilities of updating data (commands) and reading data (queries) to improve scalability and maintainability.
Event sourcing is a design pattern where changes to application state are stored as a sequence of events, rather than just storing the current state.

faqs.questions: What is the difference between frontend and backend?
faqs.answers: Frontend refers to the part of an application users interact with directly, while backend involves the server-side logic, database management, and APIs.
JavaScript is a programming language used to create interactive and dynamic content on websites.
Node.js is a runtime environment that allows developers to execute JavaScript code outside the browser, typically for server-side development.
Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework for building custom user interfaces quickly and efficiently.

faqs.questions: What is the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases?
faqs.answers: SQL databases are relational and use structured query language, while NoSQL databases are non-relational and can handle unstructured or semi-structured data.
A REST API (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style for designing networked applications, where resources are accessed via standardized HTTP methods.
Git is a distributed version control system that allows developers to track changes in their codebase and collaborate with others.
Docker is a platform that allows developers to package applications and their dependencies into containers, ensuring consistency across environments.
